name: Central Asian Music
description: Music of the former Soviet Central Asian republics, Mongolia, Western China and related neighbouring peoples.

children.name: Altai Music
children.description: Music of the Altai people, an ethnic group who live in central Russia near the border of Mongolia and Kazakhstan.

children.name: Balochi Music
children.description: Music of the Baloch people.

children.name: Bashkir Folk Music
children.description: Traditional folk of the Bashkir people, a Turkic ethnic group inhabiting the Republic of Bashkortostan (Bashkiria), a federal subject of the Russian Federation, and its neighboring areas on both sides of the Ural mountains.

children.name: Burushaski Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Burusho people of northern Pakistan.

children.name: Central Asian Throat Singing
children.description: Shared polyphonic vocal tradition of Mongolia and southern Siberia characterised by complex manipulation of harmonics.

children.name: Hazara Folk Music
children.description: Folk music of the Hazara people, mainly native to central Afghanistan.

children.name: Karakalpak Traditional Music
children.description: Traditions of the Karakalpak people, located in northwestern Uzbekistan.

children.name: Kazakh Music
children.description: Music of the Kazakhs.

children.name: Khakas Traditional Music
children.description: Traditions of the Khakas Republic (part of the Russian Federation), a form of Turkic music related to the musics of neighboring Tuva, Altai and Mongolia.

children.name: Kyrgyz Traditional Music
children.description: Traditions of Kyrgyzstan, a mountainous nation in Central Asia.

children.name: Mongolian Music
children.description: Music of the Mongols.

children.name: Pamiri Music
children.description: Music of the Pamiri people native to the Badakhshan region in the Pamir Mountains.

children.name: Pashto Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Pashtun people of southern Afghanistan and north-western Pakistan.

children.name: Shashmaqam
children.description: Modal suite that brings together lyrical and instrumental songs, poetry, and dance shared by Tajik Music and Uzbek Music.

children.name: Sufiana kalam
children.description: Classical music from Kashmir, the northernmost part of the Indian subcontinent.

children.name: Tajik Music
children.description: Music of the Tajik people.

children.name: Tibetan Music
children.description: Traditional and modern music of the Tibetan peoples, mainly produced in Tibet and also practiced in Bhutan, Nepal, and northern India, and influential on the traditions of Burma.

children.name: Turkmen Music
children.description: Music of the Turkmen people.

children.name: Uyghur Music
children.description: Music of the Uyghur people native to Xinjiang in western China.

children.name: Uzbek Music
children.description: Music of the Uzbek people.
